name: Hide and Seek (The New Dimension)
overview: Richard Bayliss has made the most Commodore games of almost anyone (Around 200 at current count). But being prolific means many no longer live up to his increasing standards, this is what he says about this game, "Hide and Seek is not what you think it is. You don't count to 10 and then find your friend this time. Instead, this game is probably one of the worst puzzle games to have graced the Commodore 64. The aim of this game is to enter a number between 1 and 9 and try to uncover two smiley faces. If you uncover the right square, you will win. But if you uncover the wrong squares 3 times, you will lose."
